divisions.name: Firearms Unit
divisions.description: Specially trained officers who respond to incidents involving firearms or threats requiring armed support.

divisions.name: Traffic Unit
divisions.description: Specialized officers who enforce traffic laws and investigate serious road traffic collisions.

divisions.name: Dog Section
divisions.description: Officers who work with specially trained police dogs to track suspects, find missing persons, and detect contraband.

divisions.name: Special Escort Group
divisions.description: Elite officers who provide armed escorts for high-value defense assets and VIPs.

divisions.name: Marine Unit
divisions.description: Specialized officers who provide security for naval bases and waterways.

divisions.name: Tactical Support Group
divisions.description: Highly trained officers who provide tactical support for high-risk operations.

divisions.name: Technical Rescue
divisions.description: Specialized firefighters trained in complex rescue operations including building collapse and confined spaces.

divisions.name: Hazardous Materials
divisions.description: Specially trained firefighters who respond to incidents involving hazardous materials and substances.

divisions.name: Water Rescue
divisions.description: Firefighters trained in water rescue operations for floods and water-related emergencies.

divisions.name: HEMS
divisions.description: HEMS provides rapid-response medical care via air ambulance. Operated in partnership with Midlands Air Ambulance Charity, HEMS crews bring critical care to the scene far faster than road ambulances.
features: Attend serious incidents like road traffic collisions, stabbings, or cardiac arrests
Deliver pre-hospital critical care such as anaesthesia or blood transfusions
Rapidly airlift patients to major trauma centres

divisions.name: HART
divisions.description: HART teams are specialist paramedics trained to operate in high-risk, hazardous environments that regular ambulance staff cannot enter safely.
features: Respond to incidents involving chemical, biological, radiological or nuclear (CBRN) risks
Support patients in confined spaces, heights, or collapsed structures
Assist in major incidents (e.g. train crashes, terrorism, building collapses)

divisions.name: CCT
divisions.description: CCT units handle the safe transfer of critically ill patients between hospitals, often requiring intensive monitoring or life support en route.
features: Transport ICU patients to specialist facilities like heart or trauma centres
Monitor and manage ventilators, medication pumps, and vital signs during transit
Work alongside critical care nurses and doctors to ensure stability

divisions.name: Incident Support
divisions.description: Specialized officers who provide enhanced support during major road incidents.

divisions.name: Vehicle Recovery
divisions.description: Specialized team equipped to recover and remove disabled or damaged vehicles from highways.

divisions.name: Winter Operations
divisions.description: Team responsible for keeping roads clear and safe during adverse winter weather.
